p: Cocoa beans are mostly consumed after several processing techniques. The cocoa pre-processing steps (harvest, breaking, fermentation and drying) are mandatory to ensure good quality of beans, but cocoa flavors develop during fermentation and roasting. The most commercial products of cocoa are made with roasted beans [ 5, 6]. The main goal of technological treatment is to improve the organoleptic properties of cocoa beans and eliminate its antinutrients (Hydrocyanate, Oxalate and Theobromine).
